result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:34 AM Defendant Carl L Sparks in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Carl L Sparks.  Attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement at this time. Attorney Borsheim entered a not guilty plea. Court entered a not guilty plea. This will be set for trial. 9:35 AM

1:25 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carl L Sparks appeared by video, in custody. Pretrial 7-12-22 at 2:00 pm and Return date 8-19-22 at 10:00 am

3:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carl L Sparks in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Carl L Sparks. State is not prepared to proceed with the preliminary hearing today. Defendant did not wish to waive his time limits. State was informed the officer is out on a call. Attorney Borsheim moved to dismiss the case. State did not object to dismissal of the felony count without prejudice. Attorney Borsheim moved to dismiss the whole case. Court dismissed count 1 without prejudice. The misdemeanor charges remain. Bond motion will be filed. 3:22 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Return date scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
